casebody.data:
In the MATTER OF: Maya Lucretia AVILA, a Minor Anna M. Nicoloff, Petitioner/Respondent,
v.
Geronimo Avila-Trujillo, Respondent/Appellant. No. ED 105751 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION FIVE. Filed: July 31, 2018
Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied October 15, 2018
Application for Transfer Denied December 18, 2018 James A. Stemmler, 1602 S. Big Bend Blvd., St. Louis, MO 63117, for appellant. Simone Haberstock McCartney, 2016 South Big Bend Blvd., St. Louis, MO 63117, for respondent. James R. Wright, Jr., 7777 Bonhomme Ave., Suite 1502, St. Louis, MO 63105, Guardian Ad Litem. Before James M. Dowd, P.J., Lawrence E. Mooney, J., and Jason M. Sengheiser, Sp.J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM

Geronimo Avila-Trujillo appeals the circuit court's determination that he is unfit to serve as the natural guardian of his daughter M.L.A., and awarding guardianship to M.L.A.'s maternal aunt. An opinion would have no precedential value. We have furnished the parties with a memorandum, for their information only, explaining the reasons for our decision. We affirm. Rule 84.16(b)(1)&(5).
